Title: Relates to parole eligibility for felony offenders; repealer
Summary: Requires that all felony offenders shall be eligible for parole after serving no more than twenty-five years of their sentence and eliminates the possibility of serving consecutive terms of imprisonment which exceed a twenty-five year sentence.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, the correction law and the criminal procedure law, in relation to parole eligibility for felony offenders; and to repeal subdivision 2-a of section 70.20 of the penal law relating thereto
